name: Hotel Des Bains, Venice Lido Resort

reviews.title: Stay here!!
reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend. Like everyone else, I read up on all the reviews to check if this was a decent hotel or not, and I am pleased to say it is. Lovely receptionists, helpful staff and concierge. The room was bright, spacious, with amazing views and all the amenities you need. The breakfast was also great - lots to eat! The vaporetto is a scenic 10 minute walk away, and the hotel also has a shuttle service to take you into Venice. The beach is literally on your doorstep. All in all, this is a really beautiful hotel to stay in, and staying in Lido was really great - it is lovely and relaxing..... I thoroughly recommend it!!!!
What a gorgeous hotel, i stayed here with my now ex husband on honeymoon and can honestly say that the hotel saved the trip for me and encouraged me to return for a later look.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Quiet Luxurious Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were magnificent, the service faultless and the food divine.
reviews.title: Grande Dame not quite ready for her close-up.
A great old lady
reviews.text: The only criticism was the location as i wanted to spend time exploring venice, but with a private bus/launch to the mainland at least the journey was comfortable.

Starwood has their hands full with the Des Bains... I wouldn't want to own this place. What a money pit! I love old hotels with charm and character as much as the next person, but when you're paying upwards of 300 Euros a night, your expectations rise accordingly.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Des Bains

reviews.text: Awesome view on the 4th floor overlooking the expansive Lido.
reviews.title: Exceptional service

likes.disliked: — Hard bed and furniture /walls needed updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very large room, minimally furnished, but with three large windows and large bathroom. There was a small foyer before entering the bedroom for the closet area.
reviews.title: Above our expectations

reviews.text: This is an older hotel with great history. Fantastic pool area, didn't go swimming (a little chilly), but that is typical for European hotels.
reviews.title: Not in July!

reviews.text: Front reception, Lola and Elena did a fabulous job, graciously welcoming and very helpful.
reviews.title: What a Grand Dame!
Very 'belle epoch' feel
reviews.text: From the bar services, breakfast services, concierge services to housekeeping services -we never waited once. On the day of departure, housekeeping provided me with fresh towels and toiletries.
